article.headline: Eastern Wash. 71, Montana 52
article.story: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) -- Brendon Merritt had 17 points and three assists Saturday and Eastern Washington avenged its only Big Sky Conference loss with a 71-52 victory over last-place Montana. Montana (5-16 overall, 2-7 league) jumped out to a 14-5 lead before the Eagles (12-10, 8-1) went on an 18-0 run -- holding the Grizzlies without a basket for 8:10 -- to take a 23-14 lead. Marc Axton added 14 points and Alvin Snow had 13 points, seven assists and six turnovers as the Eagles won their eighth straight game and sixth consecutive on the road. It was Eastern's fourth straight win in Missoula, something no team has done since Weber State won four straight from 1967-71. Montana, which trailed 31-21 at halftime, pulled within 33-26 on a basket by Steve Horne with 17:19 to play. Snow capped a 9-0 EWU run with a 3-pointer and the Eagles took a 42-26 lead with 14:24 remaining. The Eagles led by as many as 23 points, the last time on a 3-pointer by Merritt with 6:50 left that put the Eagles up 61-38. Horne led Montana with 16 points, followed by Derrick Mansell with 11. Montana coach Pat Kennedy picked up two technical fouls with 25 seconds left and was ejected.
